message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.LG

This paper deals with the task of emoji recommendation in social media posts, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV) techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and its applications. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques for recommending relevant emojis, which makes cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another likely sub-category. The use of pre-trained image classifiers and the incorporation of visual content from social media posts suggest the involvement of CV techniques, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) another possible sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of domain knowledge from Emojinet, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the use of machine learning models for emoji recommendation suggests the involvement of cs.LG (Machine Learning).
